sub_title: Monitoring & Evaluation │ Public Health │ Program Management │ Operations Research │ Capacity Building
summary: I have more than 15 years of progressive field experience in monitoring and evaluation (M&E), capacity building, program evaluation, operations research, and program management in global health and international development, with a strong focus on strategic planning, report writing, facilitation, quality improvement, qualitative and quantitative research, data management/analysis, and program design and planning in over 18 countries in Africa.

authors.headline: Monitoring & Evaluation │ Public Health │ Program Management │ Operations Research │ Capacity Building

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead all aspects of the monitoring and reporting system and active management performance of the USAID-funded Safe, Affordable, and Effective Medicines for Ukrainians (SAFEMed) Project which applies health system-strengthening best practices to create evidence-based interventions and strengthen Ukraine’s pharmaceutical system.
•	Ensure that SAFEMed takes a systematic and deliberate approach to Collaborating, Learning, and Adapting: project continuously learns from its implementation based on evidence.
•	Develop and lead the implementation of a learning plan that guides continuous learning.
•	Maintain and finetune a streamlined system for tracking project deliverables, establishing mechanisms to pause and reflect on learnings, challenges, and course corrections.
•	Identify and formulate evaluation and program audit findings, lessons learned from evaluations and studies to be integrated into broader MSH knowledge management.
•	Collaborate and coordinate with USAID funded projects and government agencies on MEL issues.
•	Conduct project performance management by actively contributing and advising the project through performance assessment: analysis of project indicators, identifying challenges and corrective action.
•	Develop and refine M&E Frameworks: ensure that project components have results-based work plan with indicators, baselines, and targets, established as outcome, output, impact levels.
•	Develop and implement a strategy to enhance data use across the pharmaceutical and supply chain systems that combines increasing awareness and understanding of data among stakeholders.
•	Provide technical support to technical teams and project counterparts in state-of-the-art data use, creation of data-rich presentations and project reports.
•	Serve on WHO Health Analysis & Assessments TWG to support humanitarian efforts in Ukraine.
•	As a member of the leadership team, support the COP in defining and adapting project strategies and its successful implementation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning Technical Advisor

profile_positions.location: USAID Abuja, Nigeria through Jefferson Consulting
profile_positions.description:
•	Provide technical assistance and leadership to analyze President’s Emergency Plan for HIV/AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) partner data, and to develop visualizations required for decision-making and reporting throughout the Country Operational Planning year.
•	Lead for Orphans and Vulnerable Children (OVC) technical area for strategic information and serve as point of contact for implementing partners and all M&E activities.
•	Lead for Gender and Gender Based-Violence (GBV) technical area for strategic information and serve as point of contact for implementing partners and all M&E activities.
•	Lead and facilitated the USAID mission-wide Performance Monitoring Plan (PMP) for the Country Development Cooperation Strategy (CDCS) for the HIV/AIDS and TB office and Strategic-Level Portfolio Review. 
•	Provide comprehensive USAID partner performance reviews and ensure accuracy of multiple database submissions.
•	Provide technical assistance and coordination required for Mission-wide Portfolio Reviews, Operational Planning development, and Partner Performance Review submissions.
•	Ensure collaboration and coordination between Monitoring, Evaluation, and Reporting (MER) and Site Improvement Through Monitoring System (SIMS) data.
•	Implement strategic planning for maximal program efficiency and ensure the accountability of the Strategic Information Department by tracking tasks assigned to Strategic Information (SI) team and individuals.
•	Improve Activity Managers ability to analyze, visualize and present data.
•	Provide technical assistance to mission Data Quality Assessment and evaluation activities.
•	Provide technical assistance in collaborative interagency data analytics and utilization activities.
•	Received Department of State Franklin Award for the provision of excellent technical assistance to the office of USAID HIV/AIDS &TB staff and implementing partners throughout the entire program cycle.
profile_positions.title: Senior Strategic Information Advisor in HIV/TB Office USAID Nigeria

profile_positions.description:
•	Serve as Evaluation Consultant for the National Academy of Science, Engineering, and Medicine (NASEM) Committee on the Evaluation of the Human Resources for Health program in Rwanda under PEPFAR.
•	Provide technical advice and subject matter expertise in evaluation protocol, data collection tools/methods, results, and final report.
•	Present research protocol and provide technical feedback to Rwanda National Ethics Committee (RNEC).
•	Participate and provide technical support in National Academies of Science Committee Meetings 
•	Conduct and coordinate primary data collection with high-level government officials and faculty and with referral/ district-level health personnel.   
•	Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis as needed for project results.
profile_positions.title: Evaluation Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Provide analytical and technical support to the supervision of the Great Lake Trade Facilitation Project (GLTFP) that facilitates and promotes small-scale cross-border trade in the border regions of the Great Lakes countries: Rwanda, Uganda, Burundi, DRC and Zambia.
•	Serve as technical advisor and regional focal point for Monitoring & Evaluation of project performance and analysis.
•	Oversee and advise implementation teams (including government ministries) in DRC, Rwanda, Uganda, and Burundi and respond to project implementation challenges and emergencies.
•	Manage and monitor project implementation according to work plan and budget and conduct implementation site visits.
•	Monitor project performance and assess project impact: including surveys, feasibility studies, and various assessments.
•	Draft and implement data collection tools and analyze project performance based on the results framework.
•	Develop and assess capacity building trainings and ensure continuous learning cycle of quality improvement.
•	Liaise between field teams and HQ; providing routine reporting on project implementation.
profile_positions.title: Consultant: Senior Monitoring & Evaluation Specialist and Project Management Specialist

profile_positions.description:
•	Serve as technical expert and lead coordinator for impact study exploring the linkages between gender and trade and the impact on access to healthcare, nutrition, and education, among traders at project border posts in Rwanda, DRC, and Uganda.  
•	Lead methodology of impact study including research design, sampling/recruitment criteria, data collection tools, enumerator training, and analysis plan.
•	Produce Terms of Reference and client contract and liaised between World Bank Technical Leads, field teams, and client on all aspects of the study.  Manage and organize project schedule and timelines with client.
•	Provide qualitative and quantitative analytical and technical support in the final analysis and writing of results.
profile_positions.title: Consultant: Research Study Manager/Analyst

profile_positions.description:
•Serve as technical expert in monitoring program performance and program evaluation, operational research design, instrument and data collection tool design, overall data management and analysis, and capacity building.
•Provide subject matter expertise on areas of public health, HIV, orphans and vulnerable children, infectious disease, gender, quality improvement, community-level outreach and project planning in Sub-Saharan Africa.
•Develop and lead proposals development relevant to technical and subject matter expertise.

Global Communities EMIRGE Impact Assessment
•Directed and implemented all aspects of impact assessment for Enabling Market Integration for Rural Group Empowerment (EMIRGE) agricultural-cooperative model program, including business development strategies, gender empowerment trainings, and farmer-field schools for cooperative members.  

Network of International NGOs (NINGO) Strategic Planning
•Co-lead the strategic planning process for NINGO members through interactive workshops, in-person interviews with members and executive committee leaders, and online surveys.  Analyzed, developed and presented final five-year document to NINGO members. 

Plan International Men Engage Girls Take the Lead Learning Assessment 
•Directed and implemented all aspects of learning assessment for Men Engage Model program in Gihembe and Nyabiheke refugee camps, with the aim to assess the level of behavior change of adolescent boys in gender-based violence and gender equality toward adolescent girls.  

Plan International Organizational Gender Mainstreaming for RPOs
•Provided technical expertise in drafting and producing a gender mainstreaming policy and strategy with Rwandan Partner Organizations.

Research Triangle International Dual Burden Nutrition Study for Children in Rwanda
•Served as technical expert in the summarization and analysis of qualitative data on the feeding practices and nutritional knowledge of families in Rwanda with children under 5 years old.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•Provided technical support to Zimbabwe and Swaziland teams in the collection and analysis of program data for program planning and learning, including the design and implementation of program evaluation and research.
• Planned, designed, and participated in M&E capacity-building initiatives for country staff; developed country program reports using EGPAF’s Data Management System. 
• Developed M&E Plans, Data Use plans, Data Quality Assurance Strategies, Quality Improvement Plans; Led these technical component for USG new business proposals.

Strategic Information & Evaluation Lead – Advancing Community-Level Action for Improving MCH/PMTCT (ACCLAIM) operations research project in Swaziland, Uganda, and Zimbabwe.
•Managed all M&E  activities: review of documents, budgets, work planning, and processes; trained M&E staff on methods and SOPs, co-authored annual donor reports;
•Designed and directed data management plan for facility-based and community-based data, including data flow, collection, aggregation, and reporting.
•Managed, developed, and implemented DQA tools for the baseline and end of project analysis for patient-level and program data; conducted TA visits to pilot tools; 

Retention Monitoring Expert, CDC’s Uganda TA Project 
•Developed and implemented training curriculum for Ministry of Health’s District Response Teams (DRTs) to use and analyze data from the national dashboard to improve the retention and adherence of HIV+ women.  Produced District Data Toolkit to pilot in 30 facilities.
•Developed dashboard for DRTs to track indicators and improve retention for mother-baby pairs.

Project Team Lead, Early Infant Diagnosis data use training in Malawi and Lesotho                                        
•Led the overall planning, development and implementation of training curriculum materials 
•Provided technical expertise to country teams to finalize a standard training module; custom-tailored the module to accommodate the needs of Malawi and Lesotho teams.
profile_positions.title: Senior Strategic Information & Evaluation Officer

company.name: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research's US Military HIV Research Program;Henry M Jackson Foundation

profile_positions.company: The Henry M. Jackson Foundation for the Advancement of Military Medicine
profile_positions.description:
•Developed measures for more effective monitoring and evaluation (M&E) of MHRP’s HIV prevention, care and treatment programs including ARV services; TB/HIV and PMTCT programs in Kenya, Nigeria, Tanzania, and Uganda, under the President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR).
•Provided technical assistance and direction for the design and implementation of M&E systems and data collection activities for PEPFAR partners, while building capacity of partners to use data to inform program planning.  Held bi-annual technical trainings with program M&E staff on data management, analysis, quality assurance and data use.
•Conducted Data Quality Assessments for site-level activities and program evaluations against stated results, including comprehensive performance reviews of community-based organizations and Ministry of Health/Defense partners. 
•Directed the development and design of an internal data warehouse and online analytical database that combined seven country programs and national indicators; Facilitated and monitored the selection and implementation of electronic medical records systems for each country. 
•Determined the training needs for program staff; reviewed and approved training curriculum for local partners in overall data management; integrated national guidelines into data collection/reporting tools and standard operating procedures.
•Assisted in the development and execution of large scale, multi-site public health evaluations; including providing expertise in country-level monitoring & evaluations systems, policies, guidance, and capacity to execute studies. 
•Conducted technical trainings for program staff on M&E planning, quality assurance, program analysis, and data use.  
•Defined Quality Improvement indicators and overall program strategy for data collection, reporting, and analysis.
•Represented the WRAIR on the PEPFAR M&E TWG; Served as Technical Reviewer for TWG and as DOD-WRAIR point of contact with other USG agencies.
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Advisor - Monitoring and Evaluation, Global Health Programs

company.name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

profile_positions.company: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
profile_positions.description:
•	Supported the formative phase of the Sango Plus Project - an evidence-based, family-centered primary care initiative supporting HIV+ women and their immediate families, while refining the intervention components on counseling of HIV, family planning, infant feeding, adherence to antiretroviral therapy, and strategies to involve male partners.
•	Served as the focal point between field staff in Kinshasa and UNC Institutional Review Board (IRB) for modifications to the IRB application. Certified in IRB application and procedures.
•	Created a data codebook and coding manual to analyze qualitative interviews from 40 HIV+ pregnant women.
•	Coded in-depth interview transcripts in French, using Atlas Ti software, to compile code reports and produce a preliminary report on research results for DRC staff.
•	Presented Women's experiences with HIV status disclosure at the 8th Annual Women’s Health Research Day at UNC.
•	Co-authored two publications: The Infant Feeding Choices and Experiences of Women Living with HIV in Kinshasa, DRC (AIDS Care, July, 2011) and The Role of Religion in HIV-positive Women’s Disclosure Experiences and Coping Strategies in Kinshasa, DRC (Social Science & Medicine, March, 2009).
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant

company.name: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)

profile_positions.company: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
profile_positions.description:
•	Developed a toolkit for community-based organizations to integrate a gender-specific approach to HIV prevention programs for women (ages 18 and over), which leveraged $500,000 for a two-year initiative on implementation of the gender toolkit with the Centers for Disease Control and the HHS Office on Women's Health. Presented at the annual OWH grantee orientation on principles of a gender-specific approach to HIV prevention.
•	Assessed governmental contracts that evaluate OWH programs; reviewed applications competing for OWH funding.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Supported ALPI’s mission to improve the effectiveness of US assistance to Africa by strengthening relationships between American and African NGOs and USAID at the policy, practice and operational levels.
•	Conducted field visits to ALPI partners throughout Africa; implemented M&E plans; initiated public-private partnerships; and mobilized the NGO community on issues of capacity building and civil society participation.
•	Supported education and advocacy initiatives in the US and Africa, for topics such as debt cancellation, HIV/AIDS, public-private partnerships, Millennium Development Goals, M&E, and capacity building.
•	Facilitated communication and information sharing around topics relevant to African development among 160 InterAction members, African NGOs and the wider development community. 
•	Managed a database of ALPI constituencies, prepared financial reports and statements for all programmatic activities, and liaised with USAID, as well as with African NGO representatives. 
•	Served as focal point for Program Effectiveness Working Group and M&E facilitation.
profile_positions.title: Program Associate
